intro: Phaeocephalum ciliare, commonly known as the silky phaeocephalum, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open, sunny habitats. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft,绒-like appearance. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense, terminal spikes. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand dry, windy conditions.
